name: Bevara
description: Bevara is an outdoor conservation startup focused on connecting outdoor users with outdoor nonprofits. We'll be performing flexible on-the-go website feature development to increase the impact of their outdoor stewardship program.

name: Lafayette Empowerment Center
description: Lafayette Empowerment Center helps youth create positive social change through the arts, community-based learning, and leadership opportunities. We'll be creating a database for submitting grants, presenting lesson plans, and registering parents/students.

name: Earth Force
description: Earth Force helps to engage young people as active citizens who improve the environment and their communities. Blueprint will create a 'Student Sustainability Challenge Portal' that allows students to submit challenges and share experiences, while also judging other submissions.

name: Foster Source
description: Finding temporary childcare (i.e. babysitting, though in the foster care system it is called 'respite') requires meeting strict county guidelines, for good reason. However, this makes it difficult for foster parents to take time off, and often leads to burnout. Blueprint's respite-matching website will allow foster parents to find each other for respite when they need it, which will increase retention rates in the foster care system.

name: Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition
description: Immigrant communities regularly face hostility and panic outbreaks that can often be alleviated through access to information. Blueprint's hotline app will enable immigrants to know their rights and receive assistance in difficult situations.

name: Anonymous Applications
tldr: Web-based Identity Redactor and Form Processor
description: Anonymous Applications is an In-house Blueprint Team for 2021-2022. Their open-source application removes identifying information from PDFs and other files using a convenient online interface. Universal version of the previous Impact on Education project, which can now be used on any document, and not just scholarship applications.

name: Impact on Education
description: To make scholarship/grant application reviews fair in the Boulder Valley School District, all applicants' identifying information is removed before the review process. However, this is currently done manually, which is extremely time consuming. Blueprint's scholarship portal will use natural language processing to automate the redaction process, in order to efficiently continue this ethical practice.

name: Thinking Huts
tldr: Web Scrapper to find Madagascan Suppliers
description: Thinking Huts seeks to 3D-print schools in Madagascar in order to increase access to education in the region. Additionally, they seek to source their materials from local suppliers to boost the nearby economy, but this is difficult to achieve remotely from Boulder. Blueprint's web scraping tool automates this arudous search process using keywords and provides a list of potential suppliers.

name: Girls Inc Metro Denver
description: Girls Inc Metro Denver's (GIMD) after-school programming to help girls learn to be smart, strong, and bold, was completely up-ended due to the pandemic. Blueprint extended GIMD's website to host their educational content in a gamified format, effectively pandemic-proofing their outreach program.

name: Safehouse Denver
description: Safehouse Denver's client database had become uncharted territory over the past few years: none of the staff were able to maintain it, and it was in need of a overhaul. Blueprint's team created a database redesign plan and instructional videos about how to navigate Apricot databases in order to improve Safehouse Denver's data insight and technical sustainability.
